ul.li1: 211 Streams of water are the heartOr “mind” of a king in the hand of Yahweh;
ul.li2: whereverLiterally “upon all that” he will desire, he will turn.
ul.li1: 2Every way of a man is upright in his own eyes,
ul.li2: but Yahweh weighs hearts.Or “minds”
ul.li1: 3Doing righteousness and justice is more acceptable
ul.li2: to Yahweh than sacrifice.
ul.li1: 4Haughtiness of the eyes and pride of heart,
ul.li2: the lamp of the wicked are sin.
ul.li1: 5The plans of the diligent only lead to abundance,
ul.li2: but all who are hasty, only to want.
ul.li1: 6He who makes treasure by a lying tongue
ul.li2: is a fleeting vapor and seekerHebrew “seekers” of death.
ul.li1: 7The violence of the wicked will sweep them away,
ul.li2: for they refuse to do justice.
ul.li1: 8Crooked is the way of a man and a foreigner,
ul.li2: but the pure is upright in his conduct.
ul.li1: 9Better to dwell on the corner of a roof
ul.li2: than to share a house with a womanOr “wife” of contention.
ul.li1: 10The soulOr “soul, life, throat” of the wicked desires evil;
ul.li2: his neighbor will not find mercy in his eyes.
ul.li1: 11With the punishment of a scoffer, the simple will become wise,
ul.li2: and with the instruction of the wise, he will obtain knowledge.
ul.li1: 12The righteous observes the house of the wicked;
ul.li2: he throws the wicked to ruin.
ul.li1: 13He who closes his ear from the cry of the poor,
ul.li2: he also will cry out and not be heard.
ul.li1: 14A gift in secretHebrew “the secret” will avert anger,Literally “nostril”
ul.li2: and a concealed bribe,Literally “bribe in the bosom” strong wrath.
ul.li1: 15It is a joy to the righteous to do justice,
ul.li2: but dismay to those who do evil.
ul.li1: 16Whoever wanders from the way of understanding,
ul.li2: in the assembly of the deadOr “Rephaim” he will rest.
ul.li1: 17A man of want is he who loves pleasure;
ul.li2: he who loves wine and oilOr “fat” will not become rich.
ul.li1: 18A ransom for the righteous is the wicked,
ul.li2: and the faithless instead of the upright.
ul.li1: 19Better to live in a land of wilderness
ul.li2: than with a wife of quarrels and provocation.
ul.li1: 20Precious treasure and oil are in the house of the wise,
ul.li2: but the foolish personOr “foolish of mankind” will devour them.Literally “it”
ul.li1: 21He who pursues righteousness and kindness
ul.li2: will find life, righteousness, and honor.
ul.li1: 22To a city of warriors, the wise ascends,
ul.li2: and he will bring down the stronghold—its object of trust.
ul.li1: 23He who guards his mouth and his tongue,
ul.li2: he guards his lifeOr “soul,” or “inner self” from danger.
ul.li1: 24The proud, haughty one: “scoffer” is his name;
ul.li2: he acts with arrogance of pride.
ul.li1: 25The craving of a lazy person will kill him,
ul.li2: for his hands refuse to work.Or “make”
ul.li1: 26All dayLiterally “All the day” he craves a craving,
ul.li2: but the righteous will give and not hold back.
ul.li1: 27The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination;
ul.li2: how much more when he brings it in divisiveness!
ul.li1: 28A false witness will perish,
ul.li2: but a man who listens will testify withHebrew “to the” success.
ul.li1: 29A wicked man is strong in his countenance,Literally “his face”
ul.li2: but the upright will appoint his paths.
ul.li1: 30There is no wisdom, nor understanding,
ul.li2: nor counsel to oppose Yahweh.
ul.li1: 31A horse is prepared for the day of battle,
ul.li2: but to Yahweh belongs the victory.
